Parent Updates
April 15, 2020
Arcanum-Butler Parents & Families,

Greetings students, parents and families! I hope everyone had a Happy Easter and were still able to enjoy some of the traditions of Easter or were able to begin new traditions. In a short time we have all adjusted to virtual family gatherings and church services or meeting at a distance or attending church in a parking lot. While we make these adjustments and deal with the changes, it is a reminder of the daily freedoms we enjoy that cannot be taken for granted.

I appreciate your patience with us during these times as we too adjust to the changes. Yesterday, we rolled out a second phase of our distance learning. As I shared last week, the goal for this next round of learning is to provide our students with six weeks worth of targeted instruction that presents key main concepts while maintaining a manageable amount of work for students and parents. We want to support you and your students as much as possible. As a reminder, make sure to check emails, have students check emails and look for updates on the district and building Facebook pages and the school website. Please do not hesitate to reach out to your student’s teacher or principal to assist you!

As we look ahead to many key activities and events for the remainder of the year, we want to provide some updates below. I have been asked the question quite often if I have an inside scoop on Governor DeWine’s plans as it relates to schools, so I wanted to make sure that I addressed that clearly. Just like all of you, I await the daily news conferences in order to get information. Our team takes the information we have available and pays attention to any foreshadowing that the governor might be providing. With that said, we believe it is in everyone’s best interest to develop contingency plans and dates for the remainder of the year. Please know that all plans are subject to change based on directions from the governor.

li.p: Teacher Parade: The previously scheduled teacher parade is on hold for now. We hope to reschedule in the near future for a fun way for our teachers and students to at least see each other’s smiling faces!

Preschool Sign Ups and Enrollment: Enrollment is currently open until April 24 online. A phone call will be made by preschool staff by the end of April 30 for notification and directions for registration.

Kindergarten Registration and Screening: If we make it back to school in May, the new dates for screening will be May 14 and 15. If you did not sign up for screening, please contact elementary principal Joni Pechie to add your name to the list. She can be reached at joni_pechie@arcanum-butler.k12.oh.us. Plans beyond that are still being discussed for possible screening dates if we do not make it back in May. A letter will be sent to all prospective students/parents explaining the plans in more detail. As a side note, we have a large number of students who had signed up for our original screening dates. Because of the large number, we will definitely be limiting open enrollment requests. Parents requesting open enrollment should make sure that they have information from their district of residence.
AVA Registration: Mr. Gray is working on enrolling returning students and will have information in the near future for new students looking to register.

District Open Enrollment: Administration is working on reviewing the open enrollment status of returning students. If you have not already done so, please visit the school website to complete the forms online this year.
8th Grade DC Trip: Mr. Vince was able to reschedule the trip for November 10-13 at no additional cost to parents. This information has been shared with those parents and students.

7th Grade Cookie Dough Fundraiser: The order has been submitted but no delivery date has been scheduled at this time. We are working to have this situation resolved as soon as possible but as of now subject to delivery restrictions.
Prom: We have a rescheduled date of May 16 at the same location as the original date.

Graduation: We are still holding out hope that we will be able to hold graduation on May 23. However, we have chosen June 13 as an alternative date. Please note for those dates we are considering options for an indoor and outdoor ceremony as well as the potential of a parade option. Mr. Stephan will be reaching out to students and parents in the near future to collect input.

The Ohio High School Athletic Association has outlined a plan for spring sports if there is a return to school. If you have a student-athlete, please check the OHSAA website for that information as it would surely impact family schedules in May and June.
Summer School: We should begin considering options for students at this time and are getting feedback from our staff as to what we will be able to offer and when that might occur.

span.p: As we have seen, the situation is a fluid one and is dependent upon the plan for Ohio to open back up. Rest assured, we will continue to discuss key aspects of your child’s education and the many important activities and experiences associated with school.

If your family has any other needs that the school can help with, please don’t hesitate to ask. We have been very fortunate to have many supporters throughout our community who are willing to assist if called upon.

Stay Safe & Healthy!
John Stephens

Parent Updates
April 6, 2020
Arcanum-Butler Parents & Families,

Hello families! I hope this update finds you physically and mentally well. Let me start off by thanking you for all of your patience, support and effort over the past few weeks! I understand the challenges many of you are facing at home and work, yet you have been outstanding in helping your student and his/her teachers the last few weeks. For many, these weeks present a different normal for what a normal day looks like. We are in uncharted territory in many ways as a school district and are doing our best to maintain levels of learning while understanding that you are shouldering the load of your careers/jobs and now are helping as part-time educators.

With Governor DeWine’s most recent extensions for school closures and the stay-at-home order extended through May 1, the district reviewed our efforts from the past few weeks in order to prepare for the next phase. In those preparations, we decided to prepare for the worst and hope for the best. We all hope to see our students back at school to finish the year; however, with that up in the air, we have prepared for our students to be out the remainder of the year.
Each school principal will be providing specific details in the next day or two, but I will summarize the plan below.

Main Goal: Provide our students with six weeks worth of targeted instruction that presents key main concepts while maintaining a manageable amount of work for students and parents. Our goal is not mastery of material, but rather exposure to material and minimized loss.

We want our seniors to graduate on time, our high school students to earn credits and our K-8 students to maintain current skill levels. Looking ahead, we understand the potential for offering expanded summer school options and assessing where students are at the beginning of the next school year to provide instruction at that point. To clarify, students will begin the next school year at the appropriate grade level and will not be retained due to the COVID-19 closure.
The following outlines the plan, but please note that the principals will provide additional instruction with more specific guidelines.

li.p: 4th Quarter: April 14 - May 29
April 6-10 will be used for teacher professional development and planning while students take a break
Report Cards will be mailed no later than Friday, April 10
April 14 - May 22 - instruction provided to students
No new work after May 22 as the final week will be used to help students complete and turn in all work
A return to school means a return to the approved end of school-year calendar

span.p: Elementary Students: Our elementary students will continue with the use of blizzard bags, but we have asked teachers to enhance the work at home with options that include video tutorials, possible “live” hangouts and guidance for introducing key topics typically presented in the nine weeks. New blizzard bags will be available on Tuesday, April 14 and Wednesday, April 15 for pick up from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM. Mrs. Pechie will provide the specifics for the pick up and drop off of materials.

Middle and High School Students: The 5th grade will continue learning with Schoology, but will have added enhancements to help present new material. Grades 6-12 will be shifting to the use of Edgenuity curriculum for all core subjects. Edgenuity is the current platform utilized by our Arcanum Virtual Academy students. It provides a more structured approach that will allow our teachers to customize based on their needs. At the high school level, there will be no change for AP and CCP classes. For special and elective courses, students will be required to complete three activities per week from a provided list.

Teachers and principals will continue to monitor students’ work daily and will respond to questions in a timely manner. As we quickly learned, it is important for teams of teachers to work together so that families are not inundated with multiple messages each day. We hope to maintain a balance of useful reminders and helpful feedback while respecting work schedules during the day.

If your family has any other needs that the school can help with, please don’t hesitate to ask. We have been very fortunate to have many supporters throughout our community who are willing to assist if called upon.
Stay Safe & Healthy and have a Blessed Easter!

John Stephens
Arcanum-Butler Superintendent

Parent Updates
March 26, 2020
Arcanum-Butler Parents & Families,
Today’s update includes a few reminders plus a summary of HB 197 that was passed by Ohio’s General Assembly yesterday and is awaiting Governor DeWine’s signature.

Reminders:
The End of the Quarter will be Friday, April 3
Assignments can be turned in before Wednesday, April 1 from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM. The school vestibule will be open throughout the weekend.
Parents can drop off assignments on Monday, March 30 at the designated lunch distribution locations. Those locations will be open from 11:00 - 12:00.
The plan is to mail grade cards on Friday, April 10 to all households.
House Bill 197 Education Items:

EdChoice Eligibility Freeze - The state’s EdChoice program was set to expand on February 1st for students/families looking for assistance to attend private school with help from the scholarship program. The expansion would have significantly increased eligibility based on report card measures. While the expansion is put on hold, any student(s) previously eligible for those funds remains eligible. This does not have an immediate impact on Arcanum-Butler as our district was not on the list of schools added based on report card performance.

State and Federal Testing - Eliminates testing for the 2019-2020 school year. This includes holding students back with the 3rd Grade Reading Guarantee or the need for seniors to pass a set of tests for graduation. Please note the language for the Guarantee: “...unless the school principal and student’s reading teacher determine the student is not reading at grade level.”

State Report Cards - Prohibits the issuance of report cards for the 2019-2020 school year and provides a one-year safe harbor from sanctions related to the report card.
Graduation Flexibility - Permits HS students to graduate if administration determines they have “successfully completed curriculum”. Administration will be working on the guidelines that will require Arcanum Board of Education approval at the April Board Meeting. That information will be distributed to all seniors. Right now, it is critical for seniors to complete all of your work assignments.

Minimum Days/Hours of School - Lifts the cap on how many days or hours of instruction schools can deliver via distance learning. Previous legislation allowed for only 3 days worth of online learning or blizzard bags. The new language states: "declares the intent of the General Assembly that school districts and other public and private schools continue to find ways to keep students actively engaged in learning opportunities for the remainder of the school year and to grant students who need in-person instructional experiences to complete diploma requirements or career-technical education programs to access school facilities as soon as reasonably possible after the director of health permits such access, even if the last instructional day of the school year has passed."

Authority for the Ohio Department of Agriculture (ODAg) to give exemptions from food processing requirements to give schools flexibility to provide meals to students while buildings are closed. We will continue to provide meals weekly for those who have submitted requests. New requests are welcomed.

New Teaching Licenses - Grants provisional teaching licenses in 2020-2021 for new teachers who were unable to take a final licensure test because testing centers were closed, if they've graduated from college and successfully completed student teaching and background checks.
Special Needs - Permits certain state-licensed individuals to provide services electronically or via telehealth communication to students with special needs.
*Please note: Governor DeWine has not announced further school closures to this point, and schools are not given guidance prior to announcements being made publicly.
Today and yesterday’s weather are blessings, so please find time to get out and enjoy the sun before more rain heads our way!
Stay safe and healthy!

John Stephens
Arcanum-Butler Superintendent
UPDATE: March 23, 2020
Arcanum-Butler Parents & Families,

Thanks for your continued patience, understanding and efforts last week in keeping instruction going! I would like to thank Pleasant View Missionary Church who donated gift cards that were distributed to many families throughout the district. I have heard many wonderful stories of families helping each other and local organizations stepping up to offer assistance. I would also like to thank Castine Church and Ithaca Grace United Methodist Church for allowing us to use their parking lots for lunch distribution.

Instruction - At this point, we have not received any further guidance on school closures. I would like to reiterate that our directive is to maintain some level of ongoing instruction and a “good faith effort”. Please understand that the assignments that students are doing are not optional assignments and that they will be used for grades. Students in grades 5-12 should be checking emails and schoology messages regularly, and make sure to complete assignments on time. With that said, please read below the plan for completing the 3rd Nine Weeks of school. Please note: Per Governor DeWine’s Order - travel to and from school is permitted to receive materials for distance learning.
The End of the Quarter will be Friday, April 3
Student assignments must be completed and submitted or dropped off starting on Wednesday, March 25 through Wednesday, April 1 from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM.
Boxes for all grade levels will be located inside the main doors. Please make sure names are on all materials/assignments.
Additionally, parents can drop off assignments on Monday, March 30 at the designated lunch distribution locations. Those locations will be open from 11:00 - 12:00
All blizzard bag and online assignments are required to be completed. Failure to complete assignments will result in a “zero” for each assignment.

For any questions, please contact the appropriate building principal. You can reach them by email or by phone.
joni_pechie@arcanum-butler.k12.oh.us or (937)692-5174 ext.1313
jason_vince@arcanum-butler.k12.oh.us or (937)692-5174 ext.1314
jason_stephan@arcanm-butler.k12.oh.us or (937)692-5174 ext.1316

Lunch - Today, we served over 100 students lunches for the entire week. Thank you to our cafeteria for preparing the lunches and several of our staff members for helping to distribute. We will serve lunch again next Monday, March 30 to the students who signed up for week 1. Additional orders can be made by calling 937.692.5174 at extension 1338. We will serve preschool students and CTC students.
State Testing - The governor has called up the General Assembly to pass legislation to cancel testing for the year. We will notify you when this officially has been passed.
Technology/Internet - If you are having issues please let your teacher or principal know and we will do our best to assist you.
Events and Activities - Everything is still put on hold as we monitor the situation. However, please note that information will soon be distributed regarding Preschool Registration for 2020-2021.

Athletics and Extracurricular Activities - The Ohio High School Athletic Association is providing guidance on these. You can visit the OHSAA website by visiting https://ohsaa.org/.
For specific questions, please contact your athletes’ coach or Athletic Director, Jason Schondelmyer.

If your student and family has a specific need that the school is able to help with, please let us know. You can contact any of the building offices or the board office with your request, and we will work with community resources to help you out.
We will continue to provide regular updates as the situation changes.
Stay safe and healthy!

John Stephens
Arcanum-Butler Superintendent
UPDATE 3-16-20, 2:00 PM
Arcanum-Butler Parents & Staff,
Thank you all for your patience during these challenging times. Please review the following updates and do not hesitate to call or email with any questions you may have.

I am sure that by now you have heard Gov. DeWine say that schools may be shut down for the year. As of now, we have our plans in place until we are scheduled to be back on April 6. If and when that changes, we will communicate to you any change of plans. We have a committee of staff members that will be meeting regularly to discuss items ranging from continuing education to rescheduling of events.

Instruction - We know that even 3 days of blizzard bags/e-days can be challenging for parents and students. It can be that much more challenging under the stress of our current situation where you are still working. The goal for the work is to maintain current levels and keep the kids engaged in the learning process, but it doesn’t replace classroom learning. If you have questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to our teachers. They are instructed to be available from 8:00 - 3:00 during the school day and should respond in a reasonable amount of time. If this is an issue, please contact the appropriate building principal. You can reach them by email or by phone.

li.p: joni_pechie@arcanum-butler.k12.oh.us or (937)692-5174 ext.1313
jason_vince@arcanum-butler.k12.oh.us or (937)692-5174 ext.1314
jason_stephan@arcanm-butler.k12.oh.us or (937)692-5174 ext.1316

span.p: For those parents with high school students taking CCP classes - further guidance will be provided in the future. Middle School and High School guidance counselors began working on scheduling. The district will provide guidance in the future if needed for planning purposes.

Technology/Internet - Spectrum has an offer for all parents. Here is a link if it can be helpful to you. To sign up, you can call (844) 488-8395. If you are having issues to the point that students are unable to complete the work, please contact your student’s principal who will assist to get paper copies sent to you.

Events and Activities - We will begin reviewing all of our cancelled activities and begin working to reschedule those. We will need to prioritize certain events and activities throughout the process. Additionally, we will look ahead to activities beyond April 3 and see how they may be impacted. Please be patient as we monitor the situation. The idea of closing for the remainder of the year can be challenging for parents looking to register new students, and parents who have been looking forward and planning graduation. We will make these important events happen. They may look different, be scheduled at a later time, but these are big moments for parents and kids - ones that we cannot just skip.
Athletics and Extracurricular Activities - The Ohio High School Athletic Association is providing guidance on these. You can visit the OHSAA website by visiting https://ohsaa.org/.

All coaches have been given guidance being shut down. There cannot be any team practices on or off campus until further notice. For specific questions, please contact your athletes’ coach or Athletic Director, Jason Schondelmyer.

Lunch - Thank you to Picnic’s Pizza and The Bank House Cafe for helping provide student lunches this week. All K-12 students are welcome to stop out and receive lunch by the businesses and volunteers. The district is reviewing plans for making “to-go” lunches available in the future.

If your student and family has a specific need that the school is able to help with, please let us know. You can contact any of the building offices or board office with your request, and do what we can to work with community resources to help you out.
We are all in this together and as we have seen things are very fluid and changing daily. Please check back for updates that will be posted regularly as things change.
Blessings to you and your families!
John Stephens
Arcanum-Butler Superintendent
UPDATE 3-12-20, 4:30 PM

As you may have heard, Governor DeWine made the decision to close all Ohio school's for a period of 3 weeks. While the governor indicated schools can remain open until the end of the day Monday, Arcanum-Butler will be closing after the day on Friday following the 2-hour early release. At this time all after school activities and events are cancelled, including tonight's choir concert and spring sport practices/events. School will be closed to all outside groups during the closure, including access to the weight room facility.

A letter was sent home today with your student(s) with information about the closure and a plan for instruction. Students will be asked to complete the 3 blizzard bags/e-day lessons already distributed for use this winter. In addition, they will receive 7 more days worth of lessons to complete. The remaining days will be considered Spring Break.
Students will be asked to take all necessary books, Chromebooks and items home tomorrow and will not be permitted in the building at all during the closure. Elementary students will be sent home with blizzard bag packets and MS/HS students will be provided on-line lessons. Students without internet access at home will be provided paper copies (based on prior requests obtained).

Teachers will be available during the first two weeks to answer questions about assignments via email and/or Schoology for the online learners. Teachers are expected to respond within a reasonable amount of time. Principals will be available by phone or email to help answer questions.
If your child is unable to attend school, please have someone come collect any items needed by 5:00 pm on Friday, March 13.
During the closure, school personnel will be disinfecting the school in its entirety, including all areas of the school grounds and buses.

We will continue to provide updates on our website, Facebook page or through One Call Now. We understand that these times are unprecedented and will challenge parents and families. We appreciate your patience and understanding. Please be safe and God Bless.
UPDATE: 3.10.20
Update: COVID-19 Recommendations for K-12
As of today, Governor DeWine has issued the following:

"The recommendation today is not to close K-12 schools. However, schools should be prepared in case they do close in the future, and parents should also be prepared for the possibility of needing to stay home with their kids."

Arcanum-Butler Local Schools have already begun planning for the potential of school closure. Those plans will be communicated ahead of time. As a reminder, the district currently has 3 blizzard bag/e-days already distributed that will be used first.
Administration will be reviewing upcoming after-school events and will provide guidance on those events soon

The safety and well-being of our students remains a top priority. It has been an active flu season and the onset of the COVID-19 coronavirus brings with it additional concerns for student health. Please take a minute to read the attached letter sent home to parents regarding the district's monitoring of COVID-19 and steps being taken to maintain the health and wellness of students.
